title: EPISTOLA Matthew Perret
html:
EPISTOLA Matthew Perret

While I do not know the meaning of the Thai word (from “On the Use of Niggardly”, 24/4) the anecdote reminded me of a story from a friend who served in the Army during the second world war. After weeks in the field, he was assigned for a few days of respite to live with a family in the Flemish-speaking part of Belgium. Almost his first request was “Wash my clothes please.” This was greeted with stunned silence since the Flemish word for “testicles” was pronounced “clothes.”

[Quincy Abbot, West Hartford, CT]
